docs.lead_paragraph: BERMAN--Miriam, died peacefully on Monday, May 3rd after a prolonged illness. She was a loving wife to Samuel Berman, who predeceased her in 1982 and a devoted mother to her two children, Alan and Patti. She was a homemaker until her husband's death, when she took the reins of Samuel Berman Inc., a successful insurance company, and became an astute businesswoman for over 20 years. She loved to travel, especially to Italy, and enjoyed opera, the ballet and classical music. She will always be remembered as stylish and elegant. The funeral will be graveside on Wednesday, May 5th through Riverside Memorial Chapels. In lieu of flowers, the family asks that donations be directed to Amsterdam House (Amsterdam Continuing Care Health System, Inc, 1060 Amsterdam Avenue, New York, NY 10025).

docs.lead_paragraph: Former employers would be reimbursed for 80 percent of the cost of claims from $15,000 to $90,000 a year for a retired worker who is 55 or older and not eligible for Medicare.

headline.main: Some Retirees Will Receive Aid to Pay Health Bills
headline.print_headline: Some Retirees Will Receive Aid to Pay Health Bills

docs.lead_paragraph: All of us need to take some time every so often to knock things off our financial to-do list. To help, we've created a series of articles and an interactive checklist to get you started.

headline.main: Financial Tuneup: Review Your Life Insurance

docs.abstract: If you've had another child or are now supporting aging parents, you may want to buy more life insurance.
docs.snippet: If you've had another child or are now supporting aging parents, you may want to buy more life insurance.

docs.lead_paragraph: A variety of consumer-focused articles appear daily in The New York Times and online in our blogs. Each weekday morning, we gather them together here so you can quickly scan the news that could hit your wallet.

headline.main: Tuesday Reading: A New Type of Car Sharing

docs.abstract: How hotels are tacking on the fees, an idea for personal car sharing and other consumer-focused items from Tuesday's Times.
